attributes.action: Up grade the A34 to motorway standard.
attributes.background: The A34 is a major road linking motorways, it regularly suffers from road closures due to accidents. These affect the economy and cause major problems on surrounding roads as there is no suitable alternative route.  It has been stated by numerous people that the A34 is no longer fit for purpose.

attributes.action: Ask the Indian government to take action against the persecution of Christians
attributes.background: India is an ally of the UK and also the world's largest democracy. The UK should ask the Indian government to allow more religious freedom and take action against the rising persecution of Christians at the hands of Hindu radical groups.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/world/2008/oct/19/orissa-violence-india-christianity-hinduism 

https://www.opendoorsusa.org/christian-persecution/world-watch-list/india/

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Religious_violence_in_Odisha 

https://www.christiantoday.com/article/hindu-extremists-threaten-to-kill-christians-in-india-if-they-utter-the-name-of-christ/63567.htm 

http://www.foxnews.com/world/2016/03/14/christian-persecution-by-hindus-rises-in-india-say-humanitarian-groups.html

attributes.action: Provide vegetarian friendly capsules on the NHS
attributes.background: Every time I have to have medication, I have to ask for liquid or tablets. Then when I speak to either doctors or nurses, they moan that "capsules are cheaper to make." If that is the case, change the capsules to vegetarian friendly capsules.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS should have to buy vegetarian friendly capsules where they are available and must work the drug companies to ensure that all capsules supplied to the NHS are vegetarian friendly. Most vegetarians know that capsules are not vegetarian friendly. So the more people (vegetarians and meat eaters) help to try to fight this change the better it is.

attributes.action: Support Parents with Learning Disabilities & Mental Health
attributes.background: Too many parents with complex needs aren’t being supported to parent. Rather than being given a chance with the right support they, have their children removed. It's plain wrong and unfair on the child as well as the parent & needs to change.
attributes.additional_details: A service should be created within social services to support parents with learning disabilities and mental health issues to parent and prevent children being taken into care and forced adoptions taking place.

attributes.action: Require phone providers to stop charging for handsets on expiration of contract
attributes.background: The government should make it law that mobile phone providers should be obliged to make sure that any customers staying in a contract past the end of a fixed deal have their monthly bill reduced to reflect the cost of the handset.
attributes.additional_details:
In October 2017 Citizens Advice found that three of the four largest mobile phone providers – Vodafone, EE and Three – continued to charge customers extra for a handset after it had been paid off as part of their fixed deal.  The majority of people who are caught out by this are the over 65s.

https://www.citizensadvice.org.uk/about-us/how-citizens-advice-works/media/press-releases/mobile-phone-networks-overcharging-loyal-customers-by-up-to-38-a-month/

attributes.action: Lower the NHS charges at dentists
attributes.background: The NHS charges at dentists are becoming more akin to private treatment and beyond the budget of ordinary people. The result is that people suffer poor dental health because they can't afford the cost.
attributes.additional_details: The average cost of seeing a Dental Hygienist is now £59. A 6 monthly check up is over £30 and if work needs doing, it can be hundreds of pounds.

attributes.action: Reform schools’ complaints system
attributes.background: The Department for Education refuse to investigate complaints from innocent students who suffer school bullying or targeting by school staff/other authorities by not obtaining all the relevant records needed for a fair investigation. We need a new body to investigate failures over the last 25 years.
attributes.additional_details: Reform the system as bullying ruins the lives of victims regardless of age or disability this new body should have all the powers necessary to investigate complaints from students/parents against schools & local authorities where children have been forced out of school, expelled, parents labelled & false reports made. Sadly, it is a daily occurrence for some schoolchildren and is sometimes so severe that victims lose out on schooling, self-harm or even take their own life. This cannot be right.

attributes.action: Create a criminal offence of filming/observing a crime without helping
attributes.background: Social media, and broader internet space, is being littered with videos, mostly taken on mobile phones, showing assaults on the public and police officers. Quite often, the filmmaker is with a larger group of bystanders, who all stand by and observe the violence but fail to summon help or intervene
attributes.additional_details: Involuntary manslaughter, joint enterprise and gross negligence all deal with bystander type liability. But they require some kind of intent or legal duty. What about those who have no intent to harm anyone, and only owe a moral duty, and not statutory. It’s not acceptable for a person, without a reasonable excuse, to observe harm being done, and fail to get that person help, or if able to, attempt to stop the harm. Filming violence or doing NOTHING should never be acceptable.

attributes.action: Ban the use of full names in GP or hospital waiting rooms
attributes.background: Confidentiality is up most important in settings such as GP surgeries and hospitals. Data protection laws are tougher now than ever. However they don’t seem to apply when in a waiting room, the professional will call you through by using your full name in front of other people.
attributes.additional_details: I am starting this petition after a prisoner attached to their guard in a waiting room was called through for his appointment. All it took was for me to google their name and gather information as to why they were in prison, how long their sentence was and their address. People’s identities should be protected in GP and hospital waiting rooms.

attributes.action: Scrap the CQC as an onerous bombastic regulation lead organisation
attributes.background: The CQC and its predecessors have developed this watch dog role since 2004, and it’s worth asking what if anything, these state appointed monitors have contributed to health and social care during that time, apart from undermining leadership and interrupting health care delivery.
attributes.additional_details: I believe the CQC have made clear mistakes over recent years. It is clear that they are unlikely to change their methodology and a majority of health care professionals across the country think they are not fit for purpose, and wish to see a change in the way health and social care is regulated.

attributes.action: Ban night shift working, for the sake of the health of workers
attributes.background: Studies have established that the health of workers in the UK is directly negatively affected by night shift working. I ask Parliament to hold a debate over this practice. Why are hard-working people being made to suffer unnecessarily, and why does the Health and Safety at Work Act not protect them?
attributes.additional_details: Long-term night shift work is associated with an increased risk of certain cancers, as well as metabolic problems, heart disease, ulcers and gastrointestinal problems. People who work night shifts or rotating shifts often don't sleep enough. Long-term sleep deprivation is known to be bad for health. Statistics show that a large amount of UK workers are shift workers and, in particular, night shift workers.

attributes.action: Stop playing Vivaldi as hold music on the benefit enquiries line.
attributes.background: Whilst it is understandable that businesses do need waiting music to occupy the minds of enquirers, playing Vivaldi's 'Spring' over and over again creates associations incompatible with the normal levels of appreciation that one should have for such a classical musician.
attributes.additional_details: Several benefit numbers spout the same song over and over again. After 15 minutes one becomes irked. After 20 minutes, the music has slightly disturbing undertones and after 30 minutes the listener turns exasperated, frantic and starts to shout at their handset. This is not ideal: it breeds frustration and resentment at Vivaldi, the benefits line and possibly the government as a whole.

attributes.action: Remove hemp from schedule 1 and reclassify as an agricultural crop.
attributes.background: We are calling for the immediate withdrawal of hemp from Schedule 1 and urgent reclassification as an industrial and agricultural crop. It should not be regulated under the Misuse of Drugs Act at all, let alone put in the most restrictive category alongside dangerous class As.
attributes.additional_details: With Brexit looming, the UK needs to become self-reliant for our sources of food, energy, fuel and raw materials. Hemp is the perfect crop to provide all of these. Hemp seeds are a nutritionally complete food. The plant could replace cotton. It's an abundant source of cellulose so can make paper and plastic. It needs no pesticides, pulls carbon from the atmosphere, prevents soil erosion and absorbs toxins from the soil, helping to prevent climate change, and it only takes 3 months to grow.

attributes.action: Make repeat offenders pay a percentage for emergency service costs
attributes.background:
Persons who are being repeatdly arrested for offending for: affray, public disturbance, ABH or GBH should pay a percentage of the emergency service costs which attended the scene.
Court costs recover some expenses but not all. A levy should be applied in these cases.
attributes.additional_details:
This method would help as a deterrent to knife attacks/gang crime, and it would also make it fair for persons who do not cause undue expenses from the emergency services.
Crime is on the rise and there are more gangs than ever.
This levy could also be expanded to moped theft gangs for the expense of a vehicle/foot pursuit.
Some persons cannot afford fines, but in that case then this would also help a legal case to get the dangerous repeat offenders locked up.

attributes.action: Re-instate legal aid in all childrens' cases
attributes.background: Currently the law with regards to legal aid and childrens cases only comes into effect if the case is in a public interest, private cases are not covered under legal aid and because of this those who can not afford a solicitor are being forced to prove they are exempt from paying court costs.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is to request that legal aid is made available on all cases regarding child law so that no person fighting for custody or access under private law is penalized or forced into debt by having to fund court cases over their child, every parent has a right and legal aid should be available for all not just the privileged few that are able to represent themselves. Without this those on benefits are unable to have assistance from solicitors to help with their case

attributes.action: The United Kingdom should have its very own  Interstellar Space Force.
attributes.background: In order to maintain close ties with our greatest ally, the United States, I call upon the UK government to pledge to the nation that we will introduce a bill for the establishment of a new branch of the Armed Forces - our very own Space Force.
attributes.additional_details: We just need it.

attributes.action: Urge newly elected PM Imran Khan to stop persecution of Ahmadi Muslims
attributes.background: All over the world a small sect of Muslims known as the Ahmadiyya Muslim Community are persecuted and oppressed. Perhaps no other place do Ahmadis face worse persecution than in Pakistan.
attributes.additional_details:
In Pakistan oppressive laws mean Ahmadis often live in fear and are denied basic rights. Ahamadis cannot vote, their mosques are often targeted, for example, in 2010 where 86 Ahmadi worshippers were killed during Friday prayers and they can face up to 3 years in jail for calling themselves Muslims. 

Pakistan has just elected a new PM. PM Khan says that he want an just and equal society. There is now a golden opportunity for the UK Government to pressure Khan to address the persecution of Ahmadis.

attributes.action: Make "vlogging" whilst driving illegal
attributes.background: Many youtubers are creating vlog videos whilst driving where they are talking to and looking at their camera and therefore becoming distracted from the road and becoming dangers to themselves and other road users. This will be encouraging others, especially young inexperienced drivers to do the same
attributes.additional_details: Vlogging is a form of online video blog usually shared via YouTube in which an individual talks to a camera, adrressing the audience. 100s of vlogs and drive with me videos can be accessed at the click of button. Those featured in these vlogs are popular young adults acting as role models for young and vulnerable teenagers who won't always realise they can be putting their own and other lives at risk if they are inspired to copy the actions as the youtubers face no consequence for their actions

attributes.action: Give full time members of the armed forces a council tax exemptions
attributes.background: Service personnel who live in a property that is not on a base have to pay council tax, however many of these due to where they are based actually live in these addresses minimally. they have to pay SILCOT the armed forces equivalent of council tax, as such they effectively pay double council tax

attributes.action: Make it a requirement for supermarket delivery vehicles to be fully electric.
attributes.background: Make it a legal requirement for the big six supermarket retailers in the UK (Tesco's, Sainsbury's, Adsa, Morrisons, Waitrose and Iceland.) to have a fleet of fully electric delivery vehicles by April 2019.
attributes.additional_details: As supermarket delivery vehicles only deliver/operate in city they are based in and surrounding towns & villages they rarely have to travel long distances which means that they would never be too far away from a charging point and when the vehicles are not being used (overnight ect) they can be charged at the supermarket ready for their next job. The electrification of delivery vehicles would help lower pollution levels and help save the earth.

attributes.action: Stop the state pension reducing tax allowances for working pensioners
attributes.background: Many people remain in work beyond retirement age training the next generation. Some work because they need to top up their income rather than turn to the state for benefits. Decreasing tax codes re-taxes PAYBACK of money already paid in tax. This was not an investment but saving.
attributes.additional_details: What the government should do is change the law so the state pension doesn't count towards someone's personal tax allowance if they are working. Having completed one working career paying for that pension, the government should allow people to continue to work without having their tax code reduced. This double tax on pensions puts people off continuing to contribute to society. The well being of remaining part time in work reduces a burden on the state. State pension is a PAYBACK and not an additional income!

attributes.action: Make it a law that every work place need to supply air conditioning units.
attributes.background: Every work place now won’t supply air conditioning as it’s not Essential however if we made it a law many schools, nursurys and work places would Benefit.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no law which says you have to go home just that your work place has to supply water. 
Let’s make a change!

attributes.action: Make more council houses available for part rent, part buy
attributes.background: I'm a working dad of 2 children under 2 year old. Me and my partner can't afford to live together as I don't earn enough to support us and pay private rent. The Government should introduce a scheme to make more council homes available for families to part rent part buy to get on the property ladder.
attributes.additional_details: More and more families are struggling to live together with young children. My children are 14 month old and a 2 week old. Like a lot of families me and my partner can’t afford to live together as I work full time and she doesn't as she raises the children. The systems we have in this country don't help people who work. Help to buy is only good if you can afford to save but with young children and paying rent that's more than a mortgage, it's hard to save.

attributes.action: A cycle path should be provided by law when roads are  redeveloped or created
attributes.background: housing estates on east way in Preston lancashire have been built and accompanying pavements but no cyclepaths have been created.

attributes.action: Provide a minimum of 100 litres of clean water per person daily, free of charge
attributes.background:
Water supply is fast becoming one of the most expensive utilities.
I believe every UK citizen should be entitled to a minimum amount, supplied free of charge by all regional water companies, enough to provide the basic human needs and maintain health and hygiene at a good standard.
attributes.additional_details:
Water is now an expensive commodity.
There is no option of choice of supplier in the water supply industry for private households.
Water is a life essential and any modern country should be required to provide a minimum amount free of charge to maintain health in the population.

attributes.action: To review current criminal law relating to rape and sexual offences.
attributes.background:
I would like the government to review current law and to implement a 3-point plan.

Educate - To make sexual education compulsory in all Secondary schools.
Prevent - Increased awareness around high-risk areas (nightclubs, pubs etc).
Prosecute - Increase current minimum term guideline for crimes.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe more can be done to reduce crime relating to rape and sexual offences. I am constantly heartbroken, daily, to read about it on the news. The crime is unforgivable and I think we have a duty as a society to call for more action which will protect the general public. 

- Approximately 85,000 women and 12,000 men are raped in England and Wales alone every year.
- Rape Crisis specialist services were accessed by 78,461 individuals an increase of 17% from 2016-17.

attributes.action: Give cadet forces more funding + get all air cadets squadrons back in the sky.
attributes.background: Cadet funding is low, especially in areas such as the Thongsbridge detachment, as their cadet building is more of a mobile home than a building. Furthermore, more than half of the air cadet forces have had their volountier glider squadrons disbanded, meaning these air cadets can no longer fly planes
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/03/19/air-cadet-cuts-will-see-more-than-half-of-squadrons-axed/ - air cadets grounded evidence

https://armycadets.com/about-us/acf-structure/the-acfa/about-acfa/acfa-funding/ - Cadets are currently charity funded

https://www.sea-cadets.org/how-were-funded - sea cadets are funded by the individual cadets and fundraising

More cadet funding will help improve the cadet forces, teaching young people great skills and getting more kids off the streets.

attributes.action: It should be mandatory for schools to provide a summer uniform
attributes.background: Schools should have to provide a summer uniform for its students such as shorts, and a polo shirt or similar. This would help people concentrate in lessons because they wouldn’t be overly hot, like I was this summer.

attributes.action: Discontinue Pay As You Dine and Reinstate Monthly Food Charges
attributes.background: Before Pay As You Dine British servicemen and women were charged a monthly food cost paid from their wages automatically, this ensured every soldier had 3 meals per day should they choose to eat at the cook house, since Payd came in the food quality has dropped dramatically, time to change!
attributes.additional_details:
Also because of lack of education and poor management a small population of soldiers have been put in a position where they cannot afford to eat, leaving the option to go “Hungry Soldier” this is incredibly degrading and embarrassing 

Discontinuing PAYD would be so much more beneficial for the servicemen of our country on a number of fronts

Things have to change

attributes.action: Allow fathers in employment to have time off for scans and parenting classes
attributes.background: First time dad. Gov.co.uk states maximum two appointments for scans etc. Employers shouldn’t be allowed to force dads to use their holidays for scan appointments. As fathers we should be allowed every appointment off work.
attributes.additional_details: My partner and I have to go to various hospitals for scans to ensure everything is right. I must use my holiday hours. I can take time off for a doctors or hospital appointment, because it's for me but I can’t have time off for scans because it's not directly for me! Slight discrimination!”

attributes.action: Limit new drivers 1100cc- first 12 mths, 14000cc-12-24 mths, 1600cc-24-36 mths
attributes.background: The cost of insurance is too high and the volume of accidents involving young drivers is also too high, bringing this in would hopefully reduce both

attributes.action: Government funding for free public transport for stage 4 cancer patients.
attributes.background:
There should be free public transport for people under pension age who have stage 4 cancer, or similarly life-shortening illnesses.
This entitlement will end at pension age to be replaced by the freedom pass.
attributes.additional_details: Those diagnosed with life-shortening illnesses will not have the opportunity to use free public transport for as long as the rest of the public on average.

attributes.action: Require all schools to allow pupils to wear skirts
attributes.background: Gender expression must not be influenced by anyone in anyway. All pupils must be allowed to wear skirts or trousers. Ability to make a choice without being judged in gender expression is important for healthy development.

attributes.action: Add recycling to the curriculum. Even if it's 1 day a year - possibly a visit.
attributes.background:
Incorrect recycling costs taxes.
I received a leaflet about what can be recycled in my area. It also explained the process which interested me. I think more education is needed.

Children are the future this will help them recycle correctly or even improve the system.
attributes.additional_details:
School is where we learn life skills, preparing us for adulthood. Recycling is currently not as efficient as it could be because the public are not fully educated. Personally I've attended beach cleans, researched where to recycle electronics / printer parts / clothes... It is all difficult to follow.

If schools had one lesson a year dedicated to recycling.
Maybe an expert from the industry could visit, they would learn the common mistakes of recyclers. Some would see it as a career path.

attributes.action: Make causing a psychological injury (mental illness) a criminal offence.
attributes.background: We are calling on the Government to make it a crime to intentionally or recklessly cause unnecessary psychological injury to another; add mental illness to the list of reportable injuries in relation to work; and ensure that the cause of any illness that leads to a suicide is fully investigated.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 4 people suffers a mental illness during their lifetime.
Sometimes this is directly attributable to the behaviour of another or others.  In these cases the only legal remedy is a personal injury claim which lacks personal accountability and doesn't encourage improved behaviour.
In addition, psychological injuries don't currently have to be reported to the Health and Safety Executive so are not monitored.
Mental abuse is serious and should be given the same importance as physical abuse.

attributes.action: Add to the school curriculum, educating young people on current world issues
attributes.background: Educating from an early age, it would bring awareness of current issues and give young people a voice as they would have opportunities to get involved. This is important as they are the next generation, therefore, it is vital that they are aware of what is currently happening in the world.

attributes.action: Require local councils to issue parking charges by recorded delivery
attributes.background: Sending PCNs by 2nd class postage does not guarantee delivery to home addresses and as a result quite often representation or appeal of the contravention is missed. Recorded delivery would eliminate this issue and the cost should be added to the original PCN meaning no cost to the council.
attributes.additional_details: There are many instances on multiple forums of people experiencing this exact issue. It’s unfair to not have received the original letter on time and as a result the fine being multiplied and even in some cases warrants issued to bailiffs. I personally didn't receive the first PCN letter and the fine was £65, now the fine is £195 as a result of not receiving the 2nd class letter sent out by the local council. Is this fair or just a money making loop hole by the councils.

attributes.action: Tax breaks for public houses that ONLY serve beverages manufactured in the UK.
attributes.background: To aid against the loss of public houses across the UK, many of which are central to a community. Also providing a boost to UK brewers/manufacturing. And creating more jobs in this sector.

attributes.action: Allow store loyalty card schemes to award points on the purchase of baby formula
attributes.background:
The law as it stands prohibits stores from issuing loyalty card points on the sale of baby milk formula. Parents are barred from amassing points to make savings.

This is unfair to parents who don't always have a choice in using formula. Also to parents exercising their right to choose not to.
attributes.additional_details:
The Infant Formula and Follow-on Formula (England) Regulations 2007 (section 23) prohibits marketing of baby formula. Loyalty card schemes are being caught up in this, barring parents from accruing points and making savings. 

The purchase is being made regardless, without promotional inducement. The collection of points by parents cannot be called marketing.

The legislation can be found here

https://www.legislation.gov.uk/uksi/2007/3521/regulation/23/made

attributes.action: Ban Govt ministers of places where homosexuality is illegal owning UK companies
attributes.background: In many countries, homosexuality is still considered a crime. This is in direct contrast to the UK, where same-sex sexual activity has been legal since 1967. Government Ministers in countries where homosexuality is still illegal should be banned from owning UK based companies.
attributes.additional_details: Mansour bin Zayed Al Nahyan is currently the Deputy Prime Minister of the United Arab Emirates, where same-sex sexual activity is illegal. He also owns City Football Group, which Manchester City FC is part of. Football is the national sport of the UK, yet the owner of the Premier League champions is Deputy Prime Minister of a country where homosexuality is illegal. If LGBT equality is to be achieved, Government Ministers from these countries cannot be permitted to own UK-based companies.

attributes.action: Reform the police complaints system
attributes.background: For over 50 years, the system has failed to protect Black/Asian people from feeling targeted and racially profiled by the police. We need a new body to investigate police misuse of powers, recommend that individual officers be prosecuted or sacked and recommend ways to reform the police.
attributes.additional_details:
This new body should have all the powers necessary to investigate complaints itself, including being able to call witnesses and summon documents and records. Most importantly, it must include representatives of victims of police misconduct to ensure it has the confidence of every individual in society. People should be protected regardless of colour or background.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/207561
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/166709

attributes.action: Stop the land asset stripping of the NHS recommended in the Naylor report.
attributes.background: Forcing NHS trusts to sell off their valuable land to cover basic costs the government won't adequately is wrong. We don't need a private profit health service system as with the US. It is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Create a National Roads Agency for the repair and maintenance of all roads.
attributes.background: I have had to repair damage to three wheels on my car which were caused by potholes. While driving I spend more time looking out for the potholes and swerving to avoid them.
attributes.additional_details: The roads in this country now compare to that of a third world country and are full of potholes. With local authorities unable to eradicate this problem and only repair the roads on a small scale it is time for the government to set up a national agency with the sole responsibility to repair and maintain roads in England. Motorists already pay enough money through their car road tax and fuel tax and get very little in return.

attributes.action: Change delay repay minimum delay to 5 minutes.
attributes.background: Currently delay repay schemes only compensate customers who experience delays of between 15 minutes and 30 minutes. Many more customers who are regularly delayed by 5 minutes or more receive no compensation. This needs to change. Train companies need to be held to account for their mistakes/delays.

attributes.action: Cap car parking charges in hospitals to £1.00 per hour
attributes.background: Cap car parking charges in hospitals to £1.00 per hour.  When you attend a hospital for treatment or to visit someone then you are probably under stress, so finding extra money to pay for car parking (especially the high charges some hospitals charge) is just adding to the stress your under.
attributes.additional_details: I suspect that some people are choosing to go without food etc just to pay for car parking charges which can mount up if  you are there for some hours and have to visit on several occassions.  The government intervened in the gambling laws they could intervene in this. These charges effect the most vunerable in our society, the sick, low paid, the ones that can't afford to go private.

attributes.action: Extend the Culture Secretary's recent FOBT decision to cover online casino games
attributes.background: On 17th May, Culture Secretary Matt Hancock opted to limit stakes on FOBTs in high street Bookmakers to £2 from £100 on the grounds they are “a social blight”. The policy needs to extend to the very same games  of chance on bookmakers/casino websites, usually undertaken in a solitary environment.
attributes.additional_details:
Online 'FOBT' games offer no social interaction and less protection than the high street equivalent.

http://www.techaddiction.ca/online-gambling-casino.html

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2395877/A-terrifying-parable-addictive-power-internet-gambling-It-began-5-online-bet-Then-ex-Major-gambled-away-750-000--family.html

http://www.gamcare.org.uk/forum/getting-addicted-online-roulette

https://www.onlineroulette.com/guides/addictive-roulette/

attributes.action: Allow Left turns on red like in the USA
attributes.background: So in the USA you can legally turn Right on a red light which helps with easing traffic and lowering co2 emmisons So I think that when applicable We should be allowed to turn left on red due to us driving on the left side of the road. This would greatly decrease co2 emmisons and traffic in cities.

attributes.action: Change the Law so Property Owners can Keep Balls that Persistently go in Gardens
attributes.background: Damage to Plants with Footballs Snapping Them off, also Scuff Marks left on Vehicles due to getting impregnated with Grit, Owners should be able to take a Pride in their Gardens and Vehicles, although a Law under Section 161 Highways it is an Offence to Play on the Highway causing a Nuisance.
attributes.additional_details:
Many people throughout the Country have these issues, it is Stupid to give the Balls back time again to be Kicked over again and again, let’s get the Law on the side of Property Owners, Many Letters in the Press suggest many suffer which should NOT be the case.

Let’s get things put right.

attributes.action: Parliament should debate the future of UK overseas territories
attributes.background: At present UK overseas territories have an anomalous status that allows them to be used for money laundering and other nebulous purposes while at the same time denying their inhabitants full sovreignty and a say in the most important aspects of their governance.
attributes.additional_details: Ideally Overseas Territories should be asked to choose between full independence within the Commonwealth or becoming integrated parts of the UK with Westminster representation (after the model of French overseas department).

attributes.action: british soldier should be free from prosecution unless dishonourably discharged
attributes.background: No British soldier should ever face criminal charges whilst in the execution of his duties within the armed forces, whether within the british isles or abroad. This should apply across the board and be retrospective save for those who are dishonourably discharged.
attributes.additional_details: Scurrilous accusations are inevitable and it is disgraceful that governments past and present have not seen fit to prevent the prosecution of men and women who have risked their very lives for the uniform and the people they serve.
